description: To remove two Leyland Cypress' within G1 TPO 257.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The two Cypress trees within the rear garden on 10 Tanworth Close form part of a row within the rear gardens of properties 1 to 10. They form a screen between properties in Tanworth Close and the flats to the rear. As a collective they have a Moderate amenity value and contribute to the arboreal character of the local area.

The recent planning application (62067/APP/2023/622) was approved with the plans showing the cypress trees to remain and protected during the construction phase. The same Arboricultural Report dated 13th April 2023 has been included within the tree work application as evidence that they should be removed. The report makes a general comment about overgrown cypress' being hard to manage and it being a better option to remove and replace, however in regard to these cypress' specifically the report uses words such as "becoming overgrown" it implies that these cypress' are not yet at the stage where they cannot be managed with the conclusion of the report showing them to
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
